job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Coralville, IA
pros: The company itself and the services they offer are wonderful. The employees truly have a positive and lasting impact on the children that they work with. The pay is decent and competitive with decent insurance benefits and opportunities for trainings.
cons: There is no paid vacation, sick, personal time or holidays; you must use your pto for everything. They do NOT treat their mental health therapists well, as their caseload numbers are not high enough to pay their employees, and as a result of this, they force these employees out. If you have young children or plan to have children, do NOT apply for a mental health therapist job here because they will force you out and force you to discharge your clients, leaving them with no support. But if your kids are grown or you don't plan on having them, and can handle the pressure of constantly being nagged about your productivity level even though it is COMPLETELY OUT OF YOUR CONTROL, because you have NO control over your schedule, then this is the job for you!

job_title: Behavioral Health Team Lead in Johnston, IA
pros: I have been employed with ChildServe for two years.  During that time I have been amazed at the level of professionalism and welcoming I have observed among the staff and leaders.  ChildServe is a mission based organization that is driven toward improving the lives of the children and families served and all decisions truly go back to that mission.  ChildServe is sincere about developing the talent of staff in a truly mission oriented way and the level of training and support given to this part of the mission is paralleled to no other place that I have been.
cons: ChildServe is a large organization and thus there can be many steps involved in changes processes.  Things are completed thoroughly but often not as quickly as we might like.  There are many leaders and many programs and it takes some time to become acquainted with them all.

review_title: ChildServe has encouraged my growth both as an employee and as a person.
job_title: in Johnston, IA
pros: I love working at ChildServe because I spend my day with some of the greatest kids in the world, and the staff I work with treat each other like family.
cons: The biggest downside is the emotional toll it takes on you when a child you are caring for is seriously ill.  It is also difficult when you find you do not have enough time in your work day to be able to do everything you want to be able to do for the children you are caring for.

job_title: Administrative in Johnston, IA
pros: I get to work with not only my direct team but with people all over the organization.  Everyone is working for the same goal, to help the kids! I have a lot of flexibility in my role and absolutely love the people I work with.
cons: As a non-profit, sometimes resources are limited.  This has pushed me to learn how to be successful with what I have.

job_title: Administrative in Johnston, IA
pros: I love working at ChildServe and look forward to coming to work every day.  ChildServe has a strong mission-driven culture that is easy to believe in.  The people here are wonderful to work with.  Great leadership and vision for this growing organization.  They believe in my growth and professional development.  I wouldn't want to be anywhere else.
cons: Computers and some of the administrative technology and software could be upgraded.  Very little to complain about overall.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Johnston, IA
pros: everyone is willing to help when you have a question or do not know how to perform a task, staff seems very down to earth and easy going, very well know company with a lot of heart and passion for serving children and familes
cons: little unorganized when knowing job tasks of new employee when asked about tasks, some staff are very critical on the newbies at times (mostly during orientation and training, sometimes  not relevant to the job), TOO casual and unprofessional at times with dress or approaching employees

job_title: Occupational Therapist in Iowa City, IA
pros: Great communication among co-workers and an overall fun work environment. This clinic is growing fast and has continuing education opportunities through the Des Moines clinic.
cons: I do not have a whole lot of cons in general. One is that since the Iowa City clinic is new to the Childserve family we are still undergoing many changes and we do not yet have all the resources that the Johnston clinic has.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Johnston, IA
pros: I love being able to help children and their families, even if it is in an indirect way. I think my co-workers are very welcoming. The overall culture is positive and inclusive.
cons: The non-profit pay is tough, but the mission is why I stay.

job_title: Manager in Johnston, IA
pros:
Things I appreciate: mission-driven organization, strong leadership team, child-focused, fun, opportunities to learn within your position - internal L&D team, flexible schedules, cross functional projects, excellent work/life balance, passionate staff

I don't work in direct care but I get to see amazing things happening every day with our kids and families. Every person makes a difference.
cons: Resources can be limited with a non-profit, PTO/paid Holidays, paid paternity leave

job_title: Registered Nurse in Johnston, IA
pros: The kids are amazing! It is so rewarding coming in to see their happy faces. The TCU/CCU is also a wonderful place because you get to do acute care skills, respiratory skills, and nursing skills all at the same time. It gives you a great chance to become comfortable with trachs, vents, and complex kids.
cons: The shifts are 12 hours, but can be negotiable.

job_title: Program Assistant in Des Moines, IA
pros: There are lots of opportunities for jobs and personal growth. They also provided education/ training seminars and I felt as though they actually their employees to benefit from working there experience. I did not work with upper management but always had good relations with my supervisors and coworkers.
cons: Can't pay much, some locations better than others

review_title: Most Genuine and Caring Work Environment That I've Ever Been a Part of!

review_title: ChildServe is a fantastic company to work with.

job_title: Manager in Johnston, IA
pros: Employee development opportunities, solid benefits package, opportunities for movement within the organization, exposure to broad array of healthcare services, mission-driven and values-oriented culture, strong executive team, growing organization with cutting-edge pediatric services, non-profit status
cons: ChildServe is a non-profit organization. As such, a non-profit company is not an ideal fit for everyone.

job_title: Site Supervisor in Ames, IA

Great partnerships between services and facilities.
I never have the same day twice.  Each day brings new challenges and opportunities.
The families and children make me strive to do better and work harder.
cons: Same things are out of date but management is working hard to make changes and improve each staff, child and families experience.

job_title: Administrative in Johnston, IA
pros: ChildServe is doing amazing things for children and it feels great to be a part of that! Leaders in the organization are kind and approachable. I enjoy coming to work every day because of the people who work here.
cons: Some technology upgrades would be beneficial to increase efficiencies.
